conclusion: To determine the trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t2, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph of object B.
The graph shows the velocity v as a function of time t.
The slope of the velocity-time graph gives the acceleration. A positive slope indicates positive acceleration, and a negative slope indicates negative acceleration.
From t = 0 to t = t1, the graph shows a downward curve, indicating that the velocity is decreasing.
The slope of the graph from t = 0 to t = t1 is negative, which means the acceleration is negative.
At t = t1, the graph reaches its minimum velocity.
The slope of the graph at t = t1 is zero, which means the acceleration is zero.
From t = t1 to t = t2, the graph shows an upward curve, indicating that the velocity is increasing.
The slope of the graph from t = t1 to t = t2 is positive, which means the acceleration is positive.
During the time interval 0 to t1, the acceleration of object B is negative.
At t = t1, the acceleration is zero.
During the time interval t1 to t2, the acceleration of object B is positive.
The trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t2 is that it starts as negative, becomes zero at t = t1, and then becomes positive.
The final answer is: The acceleration of object B first decreases (becomes less negative), then increases (becomes positive).
